sections.title: List of MBBS Colleges in Punjab 2025 with Fees, Cutoff, Admission Process for Govt. & Private Colleges

content.content: punjab is a bustling center of industry, innovation, and education, celebrated for its vibrant culture, storied past, and significant economic contributions to India. Its capital.

Renowned as a premier destination for medical education in India, punjab offers a plethora of undergraduate and postgraduate medical programs, drawing students from all corners of the nation. Admission to MBBS programs in Jammu & Kashmir is conducted through the NEET exam, with successful candidates participating in state counseling for enrollment.
The MBBS curriculum in punjab spans 5.5 years, comprising 4.5 years of academic study and 1 year of compulsory internship, providing students with comprehensive training and practical experience.

In punjab aspiring MBBS students have a variety of options available for admission. The state boasts both government and private medical colleges and universities. Typically, securing admission into government medical colleges is more competitive than private ones, resulting in higher cut-off marks for government institutions.

content.table:
Application modeOnline
Admission CriteriaNational Entrance Exam
Entrance ExamNational Eligibility cum Entrance Test (NEET)
Examination AuthorityNational Testing Agency (NTA)
Number of SeatsMBBS- 1600 (State Quota)
Admission ProcessThe admission process will be conducted through online counselling by the NEET UG Medical and Dental Admission and Counseling Board, punjab.
+91 80946-06060
Rounds of State CounsellingThere will be Four Rounds of Counselling for the state quota seats. The first round of counselling will be held in July 2023, the second round in August 2023, and the Third & Fourth Round in September 2023.
Selection CriteriaCandidates will be selected based on their NEET-UG score and the reservation criteria.
Top MBBS CollegesAIIMS Bhatinda, BFUHS Faridkot, Guru Gobind Singh Medical College, Govt. Medical College Majitha Road Amritsar, Dayanand Medical College, Christian Medical College & Hospital, Adesh Institute of Medical Sciences & Research, Govt. Medical College Sangrur Road Patiala

content.content: Punjab MBBS Admission 2025 is conducted by the BFUHS. Punjab MBBS course Admission is done through Punjab NEET counselling based on the NEET scores of a candidate. Hence, to seek Punjab MBBS Admissions, candidates must have passed their 10+2 from a recognised board from the Science stream with Physics, Chemistry, and Biology as compulsory subjects.

Punjab MBBS Admission is based on the NEET results. The NEET Exam will be conducted on May 05, 2025. The Punjab MBBS NEET Counselling is held for 85% of the state quota seats of Punjab. The MCC NEET Counselling will be done for the rest 15% of AIQ seats. Candidates must score a minimum of 50% aggregate marks to seek Punjab MBBS Admission 2025.
NTA has released the NEET UG 2025 Application Form on February 09, 2025. The last date to register for NEET UG 2025 is March 16, 2025.

Here is a list of both government and private MBBS colleges in Punjab along with fees for the 2025-26 Session. Punjab government MBBS college fees are high and Private MBBS college fees are lower when compared to other state medical colleges.
Official Website: www.bfuhs.ac.in

content.content: The NEET cutoff is determined based on various factors such as the number of applicants, the difficulty level of the exam, and the availability of seats in medical and dental colleges. It varies for different categories like General, OBC, SC, ST, and others. Each state and college may also have its own cutoff scores. Generally, higher cutoffs are seen in prestigious colleges and for popular courses. Itâ€™s crucial for aspiring medical students to keep track of cutoff trends and prepare accordingly

Seat allocation is being done in multiple phases both in All India Counseling and State Counseling of Punjab. This is because, many seats become vacant due to withdrawal of seats by the students for not getting college of their choice, not able to arrange the funds for fees, Lack of proof of their category under which they applied etc. Once the dates for reporting to the college/ Fee deposits/Submitting documents is passed all such seats made available for the next rounds. In the below table, you can find the details for Counseling rounds in All India and State Counseling followed for MBBS Seat Allocation

content.list:
• Candidates must have passed their 10+2 with at least 50% aggregate marks.
  • Candidates must be from the Science stream with Biology as a compulsory subject to apply for Punjab MBBS Admission. 
  • Candidates must have a valid NEET scorecard and admit card.
  • Candidates must not be younger than 17 years old.
  • They must be from the Punjab state

content.content: The documents required for Punjab MBBS Admission are as follows:

content.list:
• NEET Score Card
  • NEET Admit Card
  • Punjab Domicile Certificate
  • Caste Certificate, if applicable
  • 10+2 Mark Sheets
  • Challan Receipt

content.content: The expected Seat Reservation Criteria for MBBS Admission 2025 in Punjab is as follows-
Ques. How can I get admission to MBBS in Punjab?
Ans. Punjab MBBS Admissions are done based on the Punjab NEET Counselling.
Ques. How many marks are required in NEET for MBBS in Punjab?
Ans. General category students must have scored at least 117 marks out of 720.
Ques. What is the fee for MBBS in Punjab?
Ans. The MBBS Course fee in Punjab ranges from INR 10,000 to INR 10,00,000
Ques. Is MBBS available at Panjab University?
Ans. No, MBBS is not available at Panjab University.
